intro: Brachyloma vestitum, commonly known as the glossy leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, glandular leaves that are often covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. It produces small, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding insects. Brachyloma vestitum is typically found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
